CoinDetails: It is a subdivision of Kuwaiti Dinar used in Kuwait.
CoinDescription: It is a circulation coin used in Kuwait present in Middle East. 1 Kuwaiti Dinar equals 1000 Kuwaiti Fils. It is made up of Copper-Nickel composition material. It weights 6.5g with 26mm diameter and 1.5mm thickness.

CoinDetails: It is a subdivision of Saudi Riyal used in Saudi Arabia.
CoinDescription: It is a circulation coin used in Saudi Arabia present in Middle East. 1 Saudi Riyal equals 100 Saudi Halalas. It is made up of Copper-Nickel composition material. It weights 5g with 23mm diameter and 1.6mm thickness

CoinDetails: It is a subdivision of Saudi Riyal used in Saudi Arabia.
CoinDescription: It is a circulation coin used in Saudi Arabia present in Middle East. 1 Saudi Riyal equals 100 Saudi Halalas. It is made up of Copper-Nickel composition material. It weights 6.5g with 26mm diameter and 1.6mm thickness

CoinDetails: Dirham is a currency used in United Arab Emirates.
CoinDescription: It is a circulation coin used in United Arab Emirates present in Middle East. 1 UAE Dirham equals 100 UAE Fils. It is made up of Copper-Nickel composition material. It weights 6.4g with 23.8mm diameter and 1.9mm thickness. This coin is small Dirham coin, one of the two(large & small) 1 Dirham coins present in circulation.

CoinDetails: Dirham is a currency used in United Arab Emirates.
CoinDescription: It is a circulation coin used in United Arab Emirates present in Middle East. 1 UAE Dirham equals 100 UAE Fils. It is made up of Copper-Nickel composition material. It weights 11.3g with 28.5mm diameter and 2.3mm thickness. This coin is large Dirham coin, one of the two(large & small) 1 Dirham coins present in circulation.
